highlights: Leveraging ReactJS, NextJS and NodeJS to serve 4 million monthly active users on colearn.id, Indonesia’s premier EdTech startup.
Led a team of 2 frontend developers in creating a student insights platform for teachers, resulting in a daily 4-hour reduction of manual work for the operations team.
Took charge of managing a NodeJS BFF layer and achieved a 75% reduction in startup CPU utilization by optimising the build process.
Integrated a distributed job scheduler for NodeJS BFF layer to precompute data for the student insights platform and serve it via CDN for faster page load speeds.
Suggested and implemented Google ReCaptcha on public facing form pages as a measure to deter abusive traffic.
Led the development of a custom in-house video ad delivery system to reach 4 million monthly active users and capture high-quality sales leads.
Led the development of an ad-free subscription experience on colearn.id, opening up a new revenue stream.
Improved Core Web Vitals by cutting/lazy loading Javascript, boosting average page rank from 4.7 to 3.4 through collective effort.
Took responsibility for maintaining a custom legacy CMS portal, which serves as the backbone for all manual operations within the organization.
Contributed to the development of now.gg, a cloud gaming web platform with a current user base of 100 million.
Leveraged ReactJS, Vanilla Javascript, and WebRTC to provide a seamless cloud gaming experience from an Android instance in the cloud to a user’s browser.
Implemented Single Sign-On to enable seamless user profile access during cloud gaming transitions.
Contributed to a WebAssembly-based input mapping library for browser gaming with keyboards or joysticks.
Leveraged ReactJS to implement an onboarding flow for Xbox users, resulting in a 50,000 user base increase.
Contributed to the development of web applications aimed at meeting the higher education preparation needs of students.
Leveraged ReactJS, Redux, and Redux Saga to develop CMS for one of India’s largest higher education preparation institutes.
Contributed to refactoring the CMS study material preparation flow and implemented user-friendly features like drag-and-drop to enhance operations team efficiency.
